revision.comment: /* Other uses */ Changed link phrasing, formatted sentence in line with others
revision.text:
{{for|the village in Iran|Abati, Iran}} '''Abati''' is a surname. It was used by an ancient noble family of [[Florence]].<ref>{{cite book|title=Concise Dictionary of Proper Names and Notable Matters in the Works of Dante|year=1914|publisher=Clarendon Press|location=Oxford|page=1|url=https://www.questia.com/read/5635460/concise-dictionary-of-proper-names-and-notable-matters|author=Paget Toynbee|accessdate=11 September 2013}} {{Subscription required|via=Questia}}</ref>
Notable people with the surname include:
*[[Antonio Abati]] (died 1667), Italian poet *[[Baldo Angelo Abati]] (sixteenth century), Italian naturalist *[[Joaquín Abati]] (1865-1936), Spanish writer *[[Joël Abati]] (born 1970), French handball player *[[Megliore degli Abati]] (thirteenth century), Italian poet *[[Niccolò dell'Abbate]] (1509 or 1512-1571), Italian painter *[[Reuben Abati]] (born 1965), Nigerian newspaper columnist
==Other uses== * [[Abati, Iran]], village in Iran * [[Marauna abati]], species of beetle in the family [[Cerambycidae]] * The Abati people, a fictional ethnic group in [[H. Rider Haggard]]'s adventure novel ''[[Queen Sheba's Ring]]''
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{surname|Abati}}
[[Category:Italian-language surnames]]
